results.content:
This content kicks ass.
The instructor (1) knows ReactJS, (2) knows targeted audience, and (3) knows how to introduce ideas in such a way that learning is not overwhelming. I looked at a few places to learn ReactJS without much success because they dump too much details at once, but the instructor shows a very good control on the amount of data he teaches.
I wish I had known this course earlier! 

After completing more than half the course, I could comfortably read the official ReactJS documents and get further drills. This course has been a very nice bridge for that.
results.content_html:
This content kicks ass.
The instructor (1) knows ReactJS, (2) knows targeted audience, and (3) knows how to introduce ideas in such a way that learning is not overwhelming. I looked at a few places to learn ReactJS without much success because they dump too much details at once, but the instructor shows a very good control on the amount of data he teaches.
I wish I had known this course earlier!

After completing more than half the course, I could comfortably read the official ReactJS documents and get further drills. This course has been a very nice bridge for that.

results.content:
Instructors deviates constantly from what he wants to say and starts rambling. Constant sentences like "No problem at all" etc. sound like this course was done without any planning or preparation but recorded adhoc instead.

In addition I am at Section 5 and I believe I created dozens of components with a simple text in them but the amount of other topics I've learned so far is minimal. A little bit of basic routing, little bit of how to download a bootstrap project and break down component.

But there is neither a theme nor is there more complex project so far. You do the same things over and over again (create a new project, create a new component with dummy text in it and then listen to some jokes that are not funny at all when the instructor messes up his code again"

response.content:
Sorry to hear about your experience. Here are few points that we would like to mention.
1. When you work on a project, problems will come and we wanted to show you those problems and more important to solve them in front of you.
2. Intermediate application that uses login API are also there but we cannot put them in starting section. Please check content list, those apps are there.
if still you are not happy, we would be happy to give refund.
response.content_html:
Sorry to hear about your experience. Here are few points that we would like to mention.
1. When you work on a project, problems will come and we wanted to show you those problems and more important to solve them in front of you.
2. Intermediate application that uses login API are also there but we cannot put them in starting section. Please check content list, those apps are there.
if still you are not happy, we would be happy to give refund.

results.content_html:
Instructors deviates constantly from what he wants to say and starts rambling. Constant sentences like "No problem at all" etc. sound like this course was done without any planning or preparation but recorded adhoc instead.

In addition I am at Section 5 and I believe I created dozens of components with a simple text in them but the amount of other topics I've learned so far is minimal. A little bit of basic routing, little bit of how to download a bootstrap project and break down component.

But there is neither a theme nor is there more complex project so far. You do the same things over and over again (create a new project, create a new component with dummy text in it and then listen to some jokes that are not funny at all when the instructor messes up his code again"

results.content:
Die Übersicht von ES6 sowie die nötigen Packages, um es im Alltag anzuwenden, sind super für alle, die neu in diesen Standard ein- bzw. umsteigen wollen. 

Der React Teil an sich ist umfangreich, aber leider auch etwas redundant da zu fast jeder Lektion ein neues Projekt von Scratch aus gestartet wird. Zudem ist die Nutzung einerseits von firebase, andererseits von Auth0 meiner Ansicht nach unnötig. Es wird nicht detailliert darauf eingegangen, was in diesem Fall gut ist. Man hätte sich das aber komplett sparen können und nur ein System zeigen können, das aber vielleicht in mehr Tiefe. 

Das extrem große Plus dieses Kurses ist die Praxisnähe. Es werden Methoden gezeigt, die leicht nachzuvollziehen und so allgemeingültig sind, dass sie viele Anwendungsfälle abdecken. Auch die gezeigten Strukturen sind gut übertragbar. 

Der Akzent ist gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber ok. Nervig ist, dass der Dozent ständig von "this guy" spricht, egal ob ein Button, ein Tab, eine Funktion, Fehlermeldung oder was auch immer gemeint war. Genau so nervig: Die Nutzung des Artikels "the" vor jedem Substantiv, wo das nicht hingehört "the react", "the Google"... 

Aber gut, wenn ich mich darüber aufrege, wird wohl hoffentlich klar, dass der Rest des Kurses insgesamt super war. Ein toller Einstieg in JS ES6 und React für Noobs in diesen Technologien. Habe schon Kurse auf CodeAcademy gemacht (für dasselbe Geld). Der gesamte auf CodeAcademy angebotene Inhalt wird hier bereits in den ersten drei Lektionen abgedeckt. Hier ist er nachvollziebar, auf CodeAcademy nicht! Dort tippt man nur stur Code ab und weiß nicht warum.

Grundkenntnisse mit npm und - logischerweise - JavaScript hatte ich und halte ich für notwendig für diesen Kurs. 

Insgesamt sehr zu empfehlen.
results.content_html:
Die Übersicht von ES6 sowie die nötigen Packages, um es im Alltag anzuwenden, sind super für alle, die neu in diesen Standard ein- bzw. umsteigen wollen.

Der React Teil an sich ist umfangreich, aber leider auch etwas redundant da zu fast jeder Lektion ein neues Projekt von Scratch aus gestartet wird. Zudem ist die Nutzung einerseits von firebase, andererseits von Auth0 meiner Ansicht nach unnötig. Es wird nicht detailliert darauf eingegangen, was in diesem Fall gut ist. Man hätte sich das aber komplett sparen können und nur ein System zeigen können, das aber vielleicht in mehr Tiefe.

Das extrem große Plus dieses Kurses ist die Praxisnähe. Es werden Methoden gezeigt, die leicht nachzuvollziehen und so allgemeingültig sind, dass sie viele Anwendungsfälle abdecken. Auch die gezeigten Strukturen sind gut übertragbar.

Der Akzent ist gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber ok. Nervig ist, dass der Dozent ständig von "this guy" spricht, egal ob ein Button, ein Tab, eine Funktion, Fehlermeldung oder was auch immer gemeint war. Genau so nervig: Die Nutzung des Artikels "the" vor jedem Substantiv, wo das nicht hingehört "the react", "the Google"...

Aber gut, wenn ich mich darüber aufrege, wird wohl hoffentlich klar, dass der Rest des Kurses insgesamt super war. Ein toller Einstieg in JS ES6 und React für Noobs in diesen Technologien. Habe schon Kurse auf CodeAcademy gemacht (für dasselbe Geld). Der gesamte auf CodeAcademy angebotene Inhalt wird hier bereits in den ersten drei Lektionen abgedeckt. Hier ist er nachvollziebar, auf CodeAcademy nicht! Dort tippt man nur stur Code ab und weiß nicht warum.

Grundkenntnisse mit npm und - logischerweise - JavaScript hatte ich und halte ich für notwendig für diesen Kurs.

Insgesamt sehr zu empfehlen.

results.content:
The course was informative and entertaining. I've never used React before and now I have a grasp of how this works and how I could implement this new skill in my own projects.

The instructor was excellent. He kept the course at steady pace so that it was easy to follow up. The assignments were interesting and engaging. I could not recommend enough Complete React JS web Developer with ES6 enough.

Time and money well spent.
results.content_html:
The course was informative and entertaining. I've never used React before and now I have a grasp of how this works and how I could implement this new skill in my own projects.

The instructor was excellent. He kept the course at steady pace so that it was easy to follow up. The assignments were interesting and engaging. I could not recommend enough Complete React JS web Developer with ES6 enough.

Time and money well spent.

results.content:
He is going through some things very fast without a deep explanation and looks like he wants to finish it as soon as possible and he doesn't care if students understood what is really under the hood.

He behaves like we all have years of experience and that we will figure out immediately everything that he shows quickly, but actually should focus on more detailed explanations and questions "why" something works on the particular way, and to explain it deeply because there are beginners on this course who needs detailed explanations.

Also, after watching his lessons I've been many times in situation to "google" for an answer to something that was not clear to me because he didn't explain it good enough, and I didn't see any contribution on his side to help students when they ask a particular question in FAQ... mainly students are helping each other but I think he should give his contribution since he's our host here.

results.content: Excellent stuff, learning a lot as the complexity slowly builds - I'ts a bit annoying that the instructor never seems to answer questions and some of the later courses are a bit outdated so you will have to work it out for yourselves in the online docs

results.content:
I like that the course tried to include many different APIs and authentication methods, but I would rather have learned more about React and less about Firebase and Auth0. 

None of the applications were very complex, and none of the examples really prepared me to make a real app. I think the one page react official tutorial covered more React-specific material than this entire course.

That said, I did get a lot of practice at writing and reading JSX syntax which has prepared me to learn more quickly from other resources.
results.content_html:
I like that the course tried to include many different APIs and authentication methods, but I would rather have learned more about React and less about Firebase and Auth0.

None of the applications were very complex, and none of the examples really prepared me to make a real app. I think the one page react official tutorial covered more React-specific material than this entire course.

That said, I did get a lot of practice at writing and reading JSX syntax which has prepared me to learn more quickly from other resources.

results.content:
Much of the information is outdated. This course is in a desperate need for an update. Due to constant debugging, this course took a lot of time. 

Once I got to the OAuth portion I was disappointed having to debug the whole app because the header had components that didn't exist. This caused hours of work. 

If I could get a refund I would have asked for one this has been without a doubt the best example of becoming a developer the hard way.
results.content_html:

results.content: Pretty nice course, it takes you from 0 and gives you a good idea (and practice as well) of how ReactJS works. In some cases it seems like its progressing a bit slowly for my taste but in general it's a good experience and I'm happy to have taken this course.

results.content: I still need more explanations from the tutor but the course is really well prepared.Some things do not work, and need to be updated, however the course is one of the best (react) I have bought. It is pretty new, compared to competition (f.e. from Pluralsight-simply outdated) and the tutor answers to student's questions which did not happen in Pluralsight (where I paid for the year-access...). I hope at the end of the course I will be able to use react independently ;)

results.content:
A shallow course, surely not master class, not more then a simple tutorial you can also find online on blog sites.
Thought the projects would be in-depth with real world scenarios, after this course you will not be truly able to write a react app by yourself also you will not be able to open an a real complex existing react app and understand whats going on.
Change it to 'React JS Intro Level Course With Sample Mini Exercises'
results.content_html:

Thought the projects would be in-depth with real world scenarios, after this course you will not be truly able to write a react app by yourself also you will not be able to open an a real complex existing react app and understand whats going on.

results.content:
This was a really enjoyable course on the fundamentals of React. There enough examples provided by the instructor to allow a beginner to feel comfortable with React and to truly see how things work and come together.
The only thing I was displeased with was the last project. There is a step of setting up Auth0 but the syntax from the time the video was create to now has changed, creating multiple errors. There was a section of notes provided for the new syntax but after attempting the new code it still generated a number or errors. If the last project was updated with the proper Auth0 syntax or even Firebase Auth system I would provide a higher rating.
results.content_html:
This was a really enjoyable course on the fundamentals of React. There enough examples provided by the instructor to allow a beginner to feel comfortable with React and to truly see how things work and come together.
The only thing I was displeased with was the last project. There is a step of setting up Auth0 but the syntax from the time the video was create to now has changed, creating multiple errors. There was a section of notes provided for the new syntax but after attempting the new code it still generated a number or errors. If the last project was updated with the proper Auth0 syntax or even Firebase Auth system I would provide a higher rating.

results.content:
Хороший курс. Примеров многою, но возможно хотелось бы поменьше интеграций с внешними сервисами. Последняя лекция по Redux была немного скомкана.

Тем кто хочет получить базовые представления о ReactJS советую!

results.content: The starting part of tutorial were great, especially for newcomers. But then at the end on the project part. It seem like everything went quick, pointing out some cool or fad plugin for react then connecting dots by copying the codes to make it work rather than really focus and understand how code work. Not everything is well explained, but Overall it was great.
results.content_html: The starting part of tutorial were great, especially for newcomers. But then at the end on the project part. It seem like everything went quick, pointing out some cool or fad plugin for react then connecting dots by copying the codes to make it work rather than really focus and understand how code work. Not everything is well explained, but Overall it was great.

results.content: It's very detail-oriented so for people who never had contact with React before it is really good!! The only thing I can suggest as an improvement is that maybe it would be better if projects we build would continue... I mean.. instead of creating a project just to explain how to separate a component.. it would be better if we build full projects... Also, it would help if the instructor could answer questions students ask on the course.

results.content: The course is good, and the explanations as well. However, it's kind of outdated. There's a project that uses a module that has been updated, so it doesn't work as it should. Also, the instructor does not respond the questions in the Q&A. There are questions from about a year ago that haven't been answered.

Also, the instructor does not respond the questions in the Q&A. There are questions from about a year ago that haven't been answered.

results.content: This course gives amazing insight into React JS and really shows you the basics in depth. Why I gave the course a 3.5 stars is that it is outdated. I found myself having to research so much on how to make Auth0 work, Github and Firebase as well as adjust syntax all over. From the Q&A, students asked questions about the same errors that I was experiencing and the instructor never once replied back with the updated info. Researching was a good thing, I learned more that way, but other courses I've taken on Udemy, the instructor updated the videos to allow us follow along or responded in the Q&A section to help.
results.content_html: This course gives amazing insight into React JS and really shows you the basics in depth. Why I gave the course a 3.5 stars is that it is outdated. I found myself having to research so much on how to make Auth0 work, Github and Firebase as well as adjust syntax all over. From the Q&A, students asked questions about the same errors that I was experiencing and the instructor never once replied back with the updated info. Researching was a good thing, I learned more that way, but other courses I've taken on Udemy, the instructor updated the videos to allow us follow along or responded in the Q&A section to help.

results.content:
While the course offers the basics (very nicely done) - on-going support from the instructor is SORELY missed and for the most part non-existent.  The instructor leaves his students to "figure out issues" on their own.
If you are new to programming in general - this course is NOT for you.  If you have been programming using JS, jQuery, CSS and so on - you will be able to work through this using resources like Stackoverflow and such.
As a side note, I am attempting to start a small "helpers group" that will rely on some of the more experienced member to help those that are having issues.
results.content_html:
While the course offers the basics (very nicely done) - on-going support from the instructor is SORELY missed and for the most part non-existent. The instructor leaves his students to "figure out issues" on their own.
If you are new to programming in general - this course is NOT for you. If you have been programming using JS, jQuery, CSS and so on - you will be able to work through this using resources like Stackoverflow and such.
As a side note, I am attempting to start a small "helpers group" that will rely on some of the more experienced member to help those that are having issues.

LOVE IT!!!

results.content: Excellent teaching...! thanks a lot

results.content: It has been very informative so far and very good start for beginners like me
results.content_html: It has been very informative so far and very good start for beginners like me

results.content:
The course is good, but it seems that sometimes it is improvised and this causes a waste of time.
On the contrary the small summary at the beginning of each lesson is useful, especially if the lessons are not all listened in sequence, but with a significant time interval (a day or more) from one to the following.
